benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Remove tags from invoice item

covered: DELETE: Valid Deletion is well covered (all tags removed, subset via tagDef, optional headers, item with no tags) with correct 204 and empty body assertions.
DELETE: Non-Existent Resource covered with 404 for unknown invoiceItemId.
Input validation breadth: invalid invoiceItemId (400), malformed/partial/empty tagDef handling, tagDef values not on item (no-op 204), extra query params tolerated.
Auth and headers: missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy -> 400; invalid/expired auth token -> 401; optional X-Killbill-Reason/Comment supported.
Error/robustness: service outage (503), dependency outage (integration) handled, large tagDef volume boundary, security (XSS/injection) validation.
Concurrency: high-concurrency scenario checks performance and data integrity (no corruption/race conditions).
gaps: DELETE: Concurrency race with another actor deleting the same tags (double-delete/idempotency guarantees and expected status).
DELETE: Soft delete vs hard delete behavior is not verified (e.g., audit history exists while tags are removed).
Query parameter encoding: collectionFormat=multi not explicitly tested (e.g., repeated tagDef parameters, duplicates, mixed valid/invalid values).
Error response contract: no assertions on Content-Type=application/json for errors or standardized error schema; ensure 204 truly has no body.
Authorization/permissions: no 403 Forbidden scenario when credentials are valid but lack permission/role.
Status code determinism: TC14 (204 or 413) and TC19 (204 or 207) are ambiguous; expected outcomes should be clarified and fixed to a single contract.
Idempotency over time: repeated DELETE calls on the same invoice item/tags sequence not explicitly tested beyond the "no tags" case.
recommendations: Add explicit race-condition tests: (a) two clients delete the same tag(s) nearly simultaneously; (b) second DELETE after a successful first DELETE; assert defined, idempotent status (typically 204).
Verify soft-delete/audit semantics: after deletion, retrieve audit logs to confirm an audit entry with X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment while tags are no longer present on the item.
Cover collectionFormat=multi: test ?tagDef=id1&tagDef=id2 encoding, duplicates, whitespace, and mixed valid+malformed entries; define whether any invalid entry causes 400 for the whole request.
Define and assert error response schema and headers: ensure errors return application/json with consistent fields (code, message), and 204 responses have no body and no Content-Type header.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for a user lacking permission to remove tags to complement the 401 case.
Resolve ambiguous expectations in TC14/TC19: choose a single expected status per case (e.g., 413 for exceeding limits; define behavior when dependent services fail) to avoid flaky tests.
Add an explicit idempotency scenario: repeat DELETE with identical parameters on an already tag-free item and confirm stable 204 and no side effects.
